channel.title: How do I reduce Lag?
channel.description: Well, I recently have been having 15-20 ppl on my server for a while and my server is lagging A LOT. How can i reduce lag? I have a hamachi and a no-ip server. Ive been using hamachi for less lag but i still lag, how can I reduce lag? [size=20pt]I HAVE PIMPSCAPE SOURCE![/size]

item.title: How do I reduce Lag?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

[quote=“BamBam, post:10, topic:64683”][quote]How to fix:
There is no actual way to stop lagging, but if you want you can get an auto restarter to restart the server like every 20-30 minutes? And do what BamBam said above ^^. Hopefully helps.
[/quote]

A) Linux Server (Dedicated)
B) T3 Connection
C) Reliable Source.

I have reason to believe that running a server on Windows is shit. Thats right I said it[/quote]
It can’t be shit. I have Windows and T1 or T2 connection don’t know, and when I have like 30-40 people on my server it doesn’t lag at all. It’s just how you take care of your computer.

Read full topic

[b][u]How to fix:[/u][/b] There is no actual way to stop lagging, but if you want you can get an auto restarter to restart the server like every 20-30 minutes? And do what BamBam said above ^^. Hopefully helps. :)

A) Linux Server (Dedicated)
B) T3 Connection
C) Reliable Source.

I have reason to believe that running a server on Windows is shit. Thats right I said it

Read full topic

item.title: How do I reduce Lag?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

What laggs
Summoning = Lags server a “little” bit.
Commands = They DO NOT lagg anything since they don’t do anything but spawn items/tele etc.
Weapon Delay? = If it is TOO FAST then it might lagg the server, lets say alot of people use crystal bow, and it’s very fast it lags the server.
Pnpc = Might lagg people who have a crappy computer.

How to fix:
There is no actual way to stop lagging, but if you want you can get an auto restarter to restart the server like every 20-30 minutes? And do what BamBam said above ^^. Hopefully helps.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I reduce Lag?
item.dc:creator: @BamBam BamBam
item.description:
@BamBam wrote:

  1. Clean up your client. (filesize) - its always good to have a client around the size of 464 to 640kb
  2. Remove useless code
  3. Remove NPCs which are bunched together
  4. Make sure your not calling a method over and over again (noted above e.g public boolean process)
  5. Removing or moving mass objects in one area, i suggest maybe 4 to 5 objects in a area, then walk till you get pass the loading screen, and
    add more if you like.
  6. Remove any left over code that could be conflicting with your servers ability to run properly

Read full topic
